title: Big Three meeting at Potsdam
Scopenote: Introductions and informal conversation are in progress prior to the opening of the Big Three meeting in the Potsdam area of Germany.  President Harry S. Truman, British Prime Minister Clement Attlee (standing behind Mr. Truman) and Russian Premier Joseph Stalin are shown with a battery of photographers and aids.

title: Stalin, Truman and Churchill at Big Three Conference
Scopenote: Joseph Stalin, Harry S. Truman and Winston Churchill are photographed together for the first time just before the opening of the Big Three Conference at Potsdam.  Same as 63-1455-26.  From:  Papers of Charles G. Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: Churchill, Truman and Stalin Face Photographers
Scopenote: Winston Churchill, Harry S. Truman and Joseph Stalin (left to right in center of crowd)face a battery of photographers prior to the start of the Big Three Conference at Potsdam.  Same as 62-769.  From:  Papers of Charles G. Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: President Truman and Prime Minister Winston Churchill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is greeted by Prime Minister Winston Churchill at Mr. Churchill's residence in the Berlin conference area at Potsdam. Same as 70-5807. From: Papers of Charles G. Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: President Truman and Charles Ross chat with General Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman chats with General Dwight D. Eisenhower who came aboard the U.S.S. Augusta to welcome the Commander-in-Chief upon his arrival at Antwerp, Belgium.  Shown in center is Press Secretary Charles G. Ross.  From:  Papers of Charles G. Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: Activity in Front of Cecilienhof Palace
Scopenote: General scene showing activity and soldiers in front of the Cecilienhof Palace during the Big Three Conference at Potsdam.  From:  Papers of Charles G. Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: Potsdam Conference Room
Scopenote: General scene of Potsdam Conference Room on the third day's session.  President Harry S. Truman at left foreground; Gen. Joseph Stalin right center; Prime Minister Winston Churchill facing camera.

title: Truman greets Stalin
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets Russian Premier Joseph Stalin before the Big Three Conference at Potsdam.  Same as 63-1455-37.  From:  Papers of Charles G. Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: Maj. Gen Parks, Gen. George Patton, Col. Kyle, John McCloy, Mr. Bundy, Secretary Stimson in Berlin
Scopenote: Maj. Gen. Floyd Parks, Gen. George Patton, Col. W. H. Kyle, Mr. John McCloy, Mr. H. H. Bundy, Secretary of War Henry Stimson stand in a half track as they review the 2nd Armored Division in Berlin.  Same as 63-1455-45.  From: 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: Vice Admiral John S. McCain and John L. Sullivan on USS Shangri-La
Scopenote: Aboard the Essex-class aircraft carrier, USS Shangri-La, left to right:  Vice Admiral John S. McCain, unidentified sailor, Assistant Navy Secretary for Air John L. Sullivan, and unidentified officer in background.

title: John L. Sullivan and Vice Admiral John S. McCain on USS Shangri-La
Scopenote: On the flight deck aboard the Essex-class aircraft carrier USS Shangri-La are an unidentified officer at the microphone, John L. Sullivan, unidentified officer, and Vice Admiral John S. McCain.

title: Vice Admiral John McCain with John L. Sullivan
Scopenote: Vice Admiral John McCain (left) sits with John L. Sullivan, Assistant Secretary of the Navy for Air, aboard the Essex-class carrier, USS Shangri-La.

title: President Truman and his Cabinet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, photographed for the first time with his Cabinet and heads of government agencies, holds his first Cabinet meeting following the Tri-Partite (Potsdam) Conference of Berlin. Clockwise are Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, National Housing Administrator John Blandford, War Production Board head Julius Krug, War Mobilization Director John Snyder, Director of Economic Stabilization William Davis, Foreign Economics Administrator Leo Crowley, Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, Undersecretary of Interior Abe Fortas, who sat in for Secretary Ickes, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Secretary of War Henry Stimson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, President Truman, Secretary of Treasury Fred Vinson, Attorney General Tom Clark and Secretary of Navy James Forrestal. Similar to 96-434-01 and 69-61. From: John W. Snyder Papers.

title: President Truman with his Cabinet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, photographed for the first time with his Cabinet and heads of government agencies, holds his first Cabinet meeting following the Tri-Partite Conference of Berlin. Clockwise are: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, National Housing Administrator John Blandford, WPB head Julius Krug, War Mobilization Director John Snyder, Director of Economic Stabilization William Davis, Foreign Economics Administrator Leo Crowley, Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, Undersecretary of Interior Abe Fortas, who sat in for Secretary Harold Ickes, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Secretary of War Henry Stimson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, President Truman, Secretary of Treasury Fred Vinson, Attorney General Tom C. Clark and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. (Similar to 69-61). From: John W. Snyder Papers.

title: Famous Eisenstaedt Photo of Sailor Kissing Nurse in Times Square after Announcement of End of World War II
Scopenote: This is the famous Alfred Eisenstaedt photograph of the sailor kissing the nurse in Times Square, New York City, after the announcement of the end of World War II.  From:  Photo was obtained by Whistlestop editor Lenore Bradley for use in the newsletter.

title: An overview of aircraft carriers in the water
Scopenote: An aerial view of aircraft carriers in the water. Inscription on photo reads, "Fast carriers off Tokyo - Aug. 16, 1945. My dear Mr. Sullivan, Here is your Air with trimmings and concomitants. You should have stayed. John S. (McCain) to John L. Sullivan, Assist. Sec. for Air." Signature of Rear Admiral John S. McCain.

title: Dean Acheson and others are shown at NBC microphone
Scopenote: Dean Acheson (third from left)is shown at the microphone of NBC with unidentified men, including a military officer.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Autographed Portrait of Harry S. Truman and White House staff
Scopenote: Portraits of Harry S. Truman (top center) and staff signed by all:  Matthew J. Connelly, Samuel Rosenman, Charles Ross, James K. Vardeman, Harry Vaughan (same photo as 69-481 which is not signed).

title: Collage of President Truman with his White House Staff.  Others identified with photo
Scopenote: Collage of President Truman with his White House Staff.  Top row, Appointments Secretary Matthew J. Connelly, President Harry S. Truman, Samuel Rosenman.  Bottom row:  Press Secretary Charles Ross, naval aide Captain James Vardaman, and military aide General Harry Vaughan.  Original in a leather portfolio stored with albums.  Same as 69-481.  See also 96-194 for autographed photo of same.  Donor:  Thomas F. McDaniel.

title: President Truman Addresses Crowd at Dedication of Kentucky Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks from a platform filled with dignitaries during the dedication of the Tennessee Valley Authority's Kentucky Dam in Gilbertsville, Kentucky. The only identified persons are General Harry Vaughan (visible over Truman's right shoulder) and Press Secretary Charles Ross (visible behind Truman).

title: Formal Portrait of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Portrait of Harry S. Truman. Somewhat like to 58-749, but a different pose.

title: Portrait of Charles Ross
Scopenote: A portrait of Press Secretary Charles Ross.

title: Distance View of President Truman Boarding the Sacred Cow
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is prepared to board his airplane "The Sacred Cow." The other people in the photo are not identified.  This photograph is a Kodachrome enlargement.

title: Sidney W. Souers  walking up the steps of a government building
Scopenote: Sidney W. Souers, head of Central Intelligence Group, is shown walking up the steps of a government building, probably the Old Executive Office Building.  The White House is seen in the background.

title: Formal portrait of Margaret Truman
Scopenote: Formal portrait of Margaret Truman (same as 77-4015).  Original in a leather portfolio stored with albums.  Donor:  Thomas F. McDaniel.

title: Portrait of Harry S. Truman at White House Desk
Scopenote: Portrait of President Harry S. Truman at his Oval Office desk, pen in hand.

title: Charles Ross Standing at his Office Door
Scopenote: Portrait of Charles Ross, standing at his office door.

title: Official photograph of Harry S. Truman during his first term
Scopenote: Official photograph of Harry S. Truman during his first term of office in the Presidency.  Mr. Truman is sitting at his desk in the oval office.  The photograph has been signed by Mr. Truman to read "Kindest regards to Rear Adm. Sidney W. Souers" Harry S. Truman.  Image is the same as 58-42.  From:  Sidney W. Souers Papers.

title: Seated Portrait of Mrs. Bess Truman
Scopenote: A beautiful portrait of Mrs. Bess Truman seated with hands folded on her lap. She is wearing a dark dress with a simple strand of pearls.

title: President Truman Standing Outside the White House
Scopenote: An informal portrait of President Harry S. Truman standing outside the White House, smiling.  Military Aide General Harry Vaughan can be seen over Mr. Truman's shoulder.  Note the pick lapel pin.  This represents a miner's pick.  It is a pin worn by the members of an informal, unofficial group known at the "Hard Rock Club," the members of which are mostly newspaper men who covered the 1944 campaign after which Mr. Truman was elected Vice President.

title: Charles Ross With a Stack of Letters and Postcards
Scopenote: Charles Ross, peers over a stack of more than 4,000 letters and post cards received up to January 10 in response to Truman's plea to put pressure on Congress for action on his domestic program.  Ross said the letters run between 80 and 85% favorable.  From:  Charles Ross Papers.

title: Celebrities at the President's Ball
Scopenote: Shown at the President's Ball are left to right:  Charles Coburn, Florence Ross, Press Secretary Charles Ross, unidentified, Alexis Smith and Chester Nimitz.

title: Winter-time scene of White House
Scopenote: Mounted winter-time scene of the White House Executive Office.  Oversize 10x13 photo is in oversize drawer.

title: Rear Adm. Sidney W. Souers, USNR, receives the Legion of Merit
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Sidney W. Souers, USNR, at right, receives the Legion of Merit at a ceremony at the Navy Department. Assistant Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan, left, makes the presentation for President Truman. The photograph is signed "To Admiral W. Souers, with kind regards and very best wishes John L. Sullivan."

title: Eben A. Ayers at his Desk
Scopenote: A portrait of Eben A. Ayers, assistant press secretary, at his desk with pipe in mouth.

title: President Truman Throws First Ball at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman throws out the first ball at Griffith Stadium, Washington, D.C., pitching left-handed. The Washington Senators were set to play the New York Yankees. The Senators defeated the Yankees 12 to 4. Charles Ross and William D. Hassett are behind President Truman, Margaret and Mrs. Bess Truman are beside him. The owner of the Washington Senators, Clark Griffith, and Bucky Harris in uniform, stand to the President's side.

title: President Truman and Others on U.S.S. Roosevelt
Scopenote: Fleet maneuvers off the Atlantic coast on the U.S.S. Roosevelt.  The group posing, left to right: Captain E. B. Taylor, aide to Secretary of the Navy; Clark Clifford; Admiral William Leahy; Press Secretary Charles Ross; White House physician General Wallace H. Graham; James Forrestal; William D. Hassert; President Harry S. Truman; Edwin Locke, Jr.; John R. Steelman; General Harry Vaughan; Richmond B. Keech.  Same as 77-162.  From:  Papers of Charles Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: President Truman and Charles Ross on U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right, from back) and Press Secretary Charles Ross and others on board the Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers.  From:  Charles Ross Papers.

title: Charles Ross, President Truman and Admiral Leahy
Scopenote: Left to right:  Man partially obscured, Charles Ross, President Harry S. Truman and Admiral William Leahy during fleet maneuvers.  They are on the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: Profile of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Nice head and shoulders proof portrait, in profile, of President Harry S. Truman. This is the proof which the engraving produced by the U.S. Bureau of Engraving and Printing used. See also 77-166.

title: Portraits Proof Series President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Nice head and shoulders proof portrait, a profile of Harry S. Truman. This is from a series of proofs from which the engraving produced by the U.S. Bureau of Engraving and Printing was selected. See also 77-166.

title: Proofs of Portraits of President Truman
Scopenote: Nice head and shoulders proof portrait profile of Harry S. Truman. This is one of a series of proofs from which the engraving produced by the U.S. Bureau of Engraving and Printing selected. See also 77-166.

title: Charles Ross and Seizure of Nation's Railroads
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross posting the official announcement of the seizure of the nation's railroads by Presidential order in an effort to avert a transportation tie up by the strike, due to be called tomorrow, amid a scene of wild confusion as reporters flash the news by telephone to their offices.  From:  12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: Portrait of John Snyder sitting behind his desk
Scopenote: Portrait of Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder sitting behind his desk.

title: Chief Justice Vinson and John W. Snyder at Snyder's oath of office
Scopenote: Chief Justice Fred Vinson (left) administers the oath of John W. Snyder, new Secretary of the Treasury as others look on.  O. Max Gardner, Undersecretary of Treasury, stands just behind Mr. Snyder (at right).

title: Distance View of John W. Snyder Taking the Oath of Office for Treasury Secretary
Scopenote: A distance view of John W. Snyder (right) with hand raised as he takes the oath of office for Treasury Secretary. Chief Justice Fred Vinson (left) administers the oath while President Harry S. Truman (second from left) looks on. Other persons are unidentified, except for O. Max Gardner, Undersecretary of the Treasury, who stands behind Mr. Snyder.

title: Portrait of John Snyder standing behind his desk
Scopenote: Portrait (3/4 length) of Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder standing behind his desk.

title: O. Max Gardner, John W. Snyder and Fred Vinson
Scopenote: Left to right:  Under Secretary of the Treasury O. Max Gardner, John W. Snyder, Secretary of Treasury, and Chief Justice Fred Vinson following swearing in ceremonies for Mr. Snyder.

title: Receiving line after the swearing in of John W. Snyder
Scopenote: Snapshot showing the receiving line following the swearing in of John W. Snyder (second from left) as Secretary of the Treasurer.  Chief Justice Vinson stands next to the left of Snyder with Bible in hand during the receiving line.  Guests in line are unidentified.

title: Overhead view of reception for John W. Snyder after he has been sworn in as Secretary of the Treasury
Scopenote: A snapshot from above showing a reception for John W. Snyder, newly sworn-in Secretary of the Treasury. Just left of large column is President Harry S. Truman, John Snyder, and Fred Vinson. To right of column in center of picture can be seen, Harry H. Vaughan, William D. Hassett, Charles Ross, and Clark Clifford, among many others.

title: John W. Snyder and Chief Justice Fred Vinson at Snyder's oath of office
Scopenote: Snapshot showing the swearing in of John W. Snyder as Secretary of Treasurer and Chief Justice Fred Vinson giving the oath of office.

title: Receiving line after swearing in of John W. Snyder as Secretary of the Treasury
Scopenote: Snapshot showing the receiving line following the swearing in of John W. Snyder as Secretary of the Treasure.  Chief Justice Vinson stands to left of Snyder with Bible in hand during the receiving line.  Guests in line are unidentified.

title: President Truman, Charles Ross at the White House
Scopenote: A photograph showing President Harry S. Truman (left), Charles Ross (center) and unidentified man at the White House.  This has been signed by Truman and Ross.  From:  Papers of Charles Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: Atomic bomb test at Bikini Atoll
Scopenote: An oversized photo of an atomic bomb explosion on the Bikini Atoll test site.  View is at sea level. Original photograph is in oversize file.

title: President Truman and Staff on Board Williamsburg in Bermuda
Scopenote: On board the presidential yacht Williamsburg just prior to luncheon for the Governor of Bermuda.  Left to Right:  Charles Ross; General Harry Vaughan; Ted Marks; Clark Clifford; President Harry S. Truman; John Snyder; George E. Allen; General Wallace Graham and Admiral James Foskett.  From:  Papers of Charles Ross; 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: President Truman and George Allen on Yacht Williamsburg
Scopenote: The President and George Allen on board the Williamsburg during the trip to Bermuda.  Same as 63-1372.  From:  Papers of Charles Ross; 12x18 Metal Album.

title: George Allen, Charles Ross, President Truman and Ted Marks Fishing off Bermuda (Back to Camera)
Scopenote: George Allen, Charles Ross, President Truman and Ted Marks fishing off Bermuda.  Same as 66-1493.  From:  Charles G. Ross Papers; 12x18 Metal Album.

title: William Hillman and Charles G. Ross on boat in Bermuda
Scopenote: William Hillman, Mutual Broadcasting System executive, and Press Secretary Charles G. Ross (seated) aboard the Manana. They are on a trip with President Truman to Bermuda. Same as 63-1374-29. From: 12x18 Metal Album with initials CGR.

title: The President with Large Fish
Scopenote: The President hooks the largest catch of the day, 6-1/2 pound rock fish. He was fishing off Bermuda. Same as 66-1497.  From:  Papers of Charles Ross; 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Robert E. Hannegan and William D. Hassett come on board the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannagan and William D. Hassett come on board the Williamsburg on return from Bermuda trip.  Left to right:  General Wallace Graham; President Harry S. Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Ted Marks; Robert Hannegan; Press Secretary Charles Ross; William Hassett and General Harry Vaughan.  Same as 66-1545.  From:  12x18 Metal Album.

title: Full-length Photo of President Truman in Bermuda
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the Merrell Lawn in Bermuda.  Same as 63-1374-05 and 66-1488; they are better prints.  From:  12x18 Metal Album.

title: The President at Quonset, Rhode Island
Scopenote: The President holds a press conference on dock at Quonset, Rhode Island.  Same as 66-1567.  From:  12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman Aboard the U.S.S. Williamsburg en route to Bermuda
Scopenote: Aboard the U.S.S. Williamsburg ready to leave Washington. L to R: Ted Marks; President Harry S. Truman; Matthew Connelly, General Harry Vaughan; Press Secretary Charles Ross; Clark Clifford; George Allen; Admiral James Foskett; Treasury Secretary John Snyder (back to camera). Same as 66-1445. From: 12x18 Metal album with letters CGR.

title: Charles G. Ross in Bermuda
Scopenote: Photo of Press Secretary Charles G. Ross in casual pose on a boat during his trip to Bermuda.  Same as 66-1506.

title: Charles Ross, the President and Edward T. Folliard aboard the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, President Harry S. Truman and Edward T. Folliard of the Washington Post aboard the presidential yacht Williamsburg. Same as 67-5241. From: Charles G. Ross Papers; 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman and Mrs. Truman on Airplane Ramp
Scopenote: President Truman accompanied by Mrs. Truman, wave as they pause while boarding the Chief Executive's personal plane, the Sacred Cow, at National Airport for the start of the flight to Independence where they will vote next Tuesday in the Democratic Primary.  Same as 59-971, 77-2729. This photo was used by the Trumans' as 1946 Christmas gifts to the White House staff.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Eben Ayers by a Wall with Pipe
Scopenote: 3/4 length portrait of Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers leaning against a wall, with pipe in mouth.

title: John W. Snyder speaks at World Bank and International Monetary Fund meeting
Scopenote: John W. Snyder, Secretary of Treasury (standing), speaks at the World Bank and International Monetary Fund meeting.

title: President Harry S. Truman on the Flying Bridge
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses on the flying bridge of the USS Williamsburg as it sails up the Potomac River following his vacation cruise to Bermuda.  From:  12x18 Metal Album.

Scopenote: Assistant Press Secretary Eben A. Ayers in casual pose, seated.  Original negative.

Scopenote: Portrait of Assistant Press Secretary Eben A. Ayers in casual pose, seated with pipe in mouth.  We have negative which is original.

title: Justices of the Supreme Court
Scopenote: A formal studio portrait of the Justices of the Supreme Court dressed in full robes.  Left to Right:  back row, Wiley Rutledge, Frank Murphy, Robert H. Jackson, Harold H. Burton; front row, Felix Frankfurter, Hugo Black, Fred M. Vinson, Stanley F. Reed, and William O. Douglas. Original in oversized file.

title: Signa Chi Reception in honor of Charles Ross
Scopenote: Sigma Chi Reception in honor of Charles Ross given by Judge Edward A. Setzler at his home, 800 W. 61st St., Kansas City, MO.  Charles Ross is shown center of second row.

title: Harry Truman and Charles Ross with Ross Granddaughters
Scopenote: Two adopted granddaughters of Charles G. Ross, were at the train when President Harry S. Truman's train made a brief stop in St. Louis, Missouri.  A smiling Mr. Truman is shown with Ross as he holds the babies.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman at the Naval Academy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown reviewing the Naval Midshipmen at the Naval Academy at Annapolis in this rather blurred snapshot.

title: President Harry S. Truman Lights the White House Christmas Tree
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown lighting the Christmas Tree at the White House.  Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers is shown in the far right corner of the picture.  Other people are not identified.

title: Bourbon and Scotch Crystal Set
Scopenote: Bourgon and Scotch crystal set with tray and glasses; inscribed on tray "To the President -Christmas 1946 - With Deep Affection from His Staff."  12 silver glasses have the name of each staff member on them.   This is 11 X 14 studio picture (original photo filed in oversize file)

title: Bourbon and Scotch Crystal set
Scopenote: Bourbon and Scotch Crystal set with tray and glasses inscribed on tray "To the President-Christmas-1946-With Deep Affection From His Staff"  12 silver glasses have the name of each staff member on them.  This is 11 X 14 studio picture (original photos filed in oversize file)

title: Eben Ayers in Front of White House
Scopenote: Dramatic photograph of Eben Ayers close-up with the south portico of the White House in the background.

title: Eben A. Ayers Hanging Picture
Scopenote: Picture of Assistant Press Secretary Eben A. Ayers hanging a picture of Harry S. Truman on his wall.  The picture of President Truman has been autographed "Kindest regards and best wishes to my good friend, Eben Ayers.  Harry Truman."

title: Snapshot of Greta Kempton portrait of Snyder
Scopenote: A small snapshot of the Greta Kempton portrait of Snyder.

title: Photograph of Greta Kempton Painting of John W. Snyder
Scopenote: Formal photograph of the Greta Kempton portrait of Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder.

title: Greta Kempton Painting of President Truman, head and shoulders
Scopenote: Head and shoulders photograph of President Harry S. Truman from the Greta Kempton official painting (see also 84-5).

title: Head and Shoulders Photo of Margaret Truman in Hat
Scopenote: This head and shoulders photograph shows Margaret Truman wearing a hat.

title: Eben Ayers in his White House Office
Scopenote: Eben Ayers, Assistant Press Secretary, in his White House office.

title: Charlie Ross
Scopenote: Studio mounted portrait of Charles G. Ross, Press Secretary to President Harry S. Truman.

title: Eben Ayers in Front of White House
Scopenote: Full length photo of Eben Ayers, with the White House exterior from the south in full view behind him. Photo notes on the back that Eben Ayers married Mary Schinner of Watertown, NY.

title: Formal portrait of Secretary of State George C. Marshall
Scopenote: Formal portrait of Secretary of State George C. Marshall.  Original is in a leather portfolio stored with albums.  Donor:  Thomas F. McDaniel.

title: Portrait of John W. Snyder Standing by Plaque
Scopenote: One of a series of 10 x 8 studio portraits of  Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder, taken at his desk and office.

title: Army-Navy Unification Meeting at White House
Scopenote: Shown at the Army-Navy Unification meeting held in the White House are left to right: Secretary of War Robert Patterson; Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Gen. Lauris Norstad; Press Secretary Charles Ross; Admiral William Leahy; General Floyd Parks; General Dwight D. Eisenhower; Admiral Chester Nimitz; Admiral Forrest Sherman. From: Charles Ross Papers; 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman and his Cabinet
Scopenote: Portrait of President Truman and his Cabinet seated around a table.  Left to right around table: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, Secretary of Interior Julius Krug, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of Treasury John Snyder, Attorney General Tom Clark, and Secretary of Navy James Forrestal.

title: U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: A good photo showing the presidential yacht Williamsburg from the bow backward.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Exterior view of the Presidential Yacht Williamsburg
Scopenote: Nice exterior view of the Williamsburg, the presidential yacht.

title: Painting, PEACEMAKERS by George Healy, Viewed by Members of Press
Scopenote: Shown pointing to a painting of the PEACEMAKERS by George Healy is Press Secretary Charles Ross.  Left to right:  Joseph Fox, Washington Evening Star; Ernest B. "Tony" Vaccaro, Associated Press; Merriman Smith, United Press; Eben Ayers, and Charles Ross.

title: President Truman at Key West
Scopenote: A color photograph showing President Truman as he relaxes in a chair during his trip to Key West. The President is reading some papers and has a pith helmet in his lap. Paul M. Angle's book, The Lincoln Reader, is open nearby on the ground. From: Papers of Charles Ross, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman and Others at Little White House at Key West
Scopenote: Admiral James Foskett, Presidential Aide John Steelman, Mr. Neal Helm, President Harry S. Truman, Military Aide General Harry Vaughan, and Press Secretary Charles Ross relaxing under the palms in the Little White House garden in Key West, Florida.  Similar to 66-1352.

title: President Truman at his White House Desk
Scopenote: Excellent photograph of President Harry S. Truman at his White House desk (grinning) his second year in office.  Same photo as 69-628 but a much better quality print.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends a Baseball Game
Scopenote: President Truman throws out the first ball for the opening day game between Washington Nationals and New York Yankees.  Shown to the left of Mr. Truman is Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy, Manager Ossie Bluege, Washington Nationals and Bucky Harris, Manager of the New York Yankees.  From:  Charles Ross Papers; 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Miguel Aleman of Mexico with President Truman in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: President Miguel Aleman of Mexico arrives in Washington and is presented with the Key to the District in ceremonies at the District Building.  President Truman stands with Aleman just before the two Presidents left for the White House.  From:  Charles Ross Papers; 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Jack Romagna and Charles Ross
Scopenote: Photo of Jack Romagna and Press Secretary Charles Ross (seated at window) at the Hotel Muehlebach, Kansas City, Missouri, during the grave illness of the President's mother.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: General Vaughan, Charles Ross, Admiral Foskett and Matthew Connelly in Kansas City
Scopenote: A group picture of General Harry Vaughan, Press Secretary Charles Ross, Appointments Secretary Matthew Connelly and Admiral James Foskett at the Hotel Muehlebach, Kansas City, Missouri, during the grave illness of the President's mother.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Distance Portrait of John Snyder on Staircase
Scopenote: Portrait of Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder standing on an ornate staircase.  Original 10x13 portrait in oversize file.

title: President Truman with Birthday Cake from One More Club
Scopenote: A smiling President Harry S. Truman is shown with a double layer birthday cake from "The One More Club," the still photographers assigned to the White House. From: Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: John W. Snyder with members of the American Banking Association Committee on Government Borrowing
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder, center, shown with unidentified members of the American Banking Association Committee on Government Borrowing.

title: President Truman at Desk in the White House
Scopenote: A good portrait of President Harry S. Truman at his desk at the White House.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Truman and Matthew J. Connelly in the Oval Office
Scopenote: Photograph of President Harry S. Truman (seated at right) and appointment secretary Matthew J. Connelly (standing) taken in the Oval Office. title: Sugar Loaf mountain in Rio de Janeiro

Truman is returning from his trip to Brazil. Admiral William Leahy can be seen second from right. From: Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan Aboard an Unidentified Ship
Scopenote: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan aboard an unidentified ship.  All military personnel unidentified.

title: Margaret at Parade in Brazil
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (fourth from left), surrounded by Senoritas and Senoras, watches the three hour long parade in Rio de Janeiro to celebrate Brazil's independence.  Margaret Truman accompanied her parents on this trip.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman, Margaret Truman and Stanley Woodward in Rio de Janeiro Harbor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, and Stanley Woodward on board the U.S.S. Missouri, in the harbor of Rio de Janeiro. Sugar Loaf mountain in the background. From: Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President and Margaret Truman and Charles Ross on U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: Snapshot of President and Margaret Truman and Charles Ross on board the U.S.S. Missouri. They are attending ceremonies for crossing the equator on the return trip from Brazil.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: A Comical View of Charles Ross and Others on USS Missouri
Scopenote: A snapshot showing a comical view of Charlie Ross and others on board the USS Missouri as they cross the Equator during President Truman's return trip from Brazil. Left to right:  Admiral Robert Dennison, John Steelman, Charles Ross.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Margaret sings "Anchor Aweigh" on USS Missouri
Scopenote: Snapshot of Margaret Truman as she sings "Anchors Aweigh" during the ceremonies on board the USS Missouri. They are crossing the equator.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Margaret Truman and King Neptune's Court on USS Missouri
Scopenote: A snapshot of Margaret Truman being summoned before the King Neptune's Court on the USS Missouri returning from a trip to Brazil.  (Equator crossing ritual)  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Bess Truman Before King Neptune's Court
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman called before King Neptune's Court on the USS Missouri (equator passing ceremony). From: Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Crossing the Equator on USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman watching the hazing on board the USS Missouri in honor of the crossing the Equator.  Press Secretary Charles Ross is behind Margaret. Others are unidentified.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Navy Secretary John Sullivan Shown During Ceremonies at the U.S. Naval Academy at Annapolis
Scopenote: Navy Secretary John Sullivan shown with hand over his heart during ceremonies at the U.S. Naval Academy at Annapolis.  All others unidentified.

title: First Televised Speech from the White House
Scopenote: Preparations for the first televised address at the White House, Sunday, October 5, 1947. President Harry S. Truman (left, behind lectern) urged viewers to save food for Europe. Charles Luckman, Chairman of the Citizen's Food Committee, stands next to the president. A cameraman looks through a large television camera at right. From: Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan Aboard the U.S.S. Shangri-La
Scopenote: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan aboard the Essex-class carrier, U.S.S. Shangri-La.

title: Navy Secretary John Sullivan on U.S.S. Shangri-La
Scopenote: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan (left) shown with unidentified Naval officer on the U.S.S. Shangri-Law aircraft carrier.

title: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan with Naval Officers on U.S.S. Shangri-La
Scopenote: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan (with binoculars) with unidentified Naval officers. They are on the aircraft carrier U.S.S. Shangri-La.

title: President and Mrs. Truman with members of the Cabinet
Scopenote: President and Mrs. Truman pose with members of the Cabinet on the White House steps after the President's address to the joint session of the 80th Congress.  Left to right:  Secretary of State George C. Marshall; Mrs. Truman; Treasury Secretary John Snyder; President Harry S. Truman, Rear, left to right: Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Agricultural Secretary Clinton Anderson; Attorney General Tom Clark; Press Secretary Charles Ross.  Same as 59-1398.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman with his Movie Camera at Key West
Scopenote: Vacationing President Harry S. Truman (right), like most any Florida tourist, turns his movie camera on a distinguished trio in Key West.  Left to Right:  Charles G. Ross, Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy and Adm. James E. Foskett, Naval Aide.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Distance View of John W. Snyder at Old Timers' Reunion
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder is shown with others in the oversized photo of the Old Timers' Reunion in honor of the Honorable Jesse H. Jones by the alumni and undergraduates of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation.  Snyder is shown at the head table, sixth from the left.  ORIGINAL PHOTO IS IN OVERSIZED FILE.     From:  John W. Snyder Papers.

title: Maurice Latta and Matthew Connelly Examine Legislation for Emergency Winter Relief
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signed legislation today which authorizes $597,000,000 in emergency winter relief for France, Italy and Austria. Left to Right: Maurice Latta, Chief Clerk of the White House, and Matthew Connelly, Presidential Secretary, examining Mr. Truman's signature on the emergency aid legislation. Same as 77-315. From: Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Margaret Truman after Performance at Constitution Hall
Scopenote: Margaret Truman, daughter of the Chief Executive, finished her present concert tour this evening with a final concert at Constitution Hall in Washington.  She sang before an audience of almost 4,000 persons, among whom were top administration and diplomatic corps members.  Miss Truman is shown as she caught a bouquet of flowers after the concert was concluded.  Same as 77-333.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: The puppy Feller arriving at the White House
Scopenote: The Cocker Spaniel puppy Feller, a gift to President Truman, outside his crate upon arrival at the White House.  From:  12x18 metal album from Charles G. Ross Papers.

title: White House Door Decorations for Christmas
Scopenote: White House preparations for Christmas were completed today with the decoration of the entrance to the Executive Mansion. Unidentified man in doorway.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: A portrait of General Harry H. Vaughan
Scopenote: A portrait of General Harry H. Vaughan, similar to 67-464.

title: Greta Kempton gazes at painting of John W. Snyder
Scopenote: Greta Kempton gazes at the painting of John W. Snyder which she did in 1948.  From:  John W. Snyder Papers.

title: Eben A. Ayers at his desk with Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Photo of Eben A. Ayers (left), at his desk, talking with an unidentified man.  Mr. Ayers is Assistant Press Secretary.

title: Eben A. Ayers with Group of Newspaper Reporters
Scopenote: Photo of Eben A. Ayers (center), Assistant Press Secretary, with a group of newspaper reporters.

title: President Truman, seated in garden, at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, in vacation sports attire, on the lawn outside the Little White House in the U. S. Naval Base, Key West, Florida. Originally color, but now faded.

title: The Presidential yacht, Williamsburg
Scopenote: The Presidential yacht, U.S.S. Williamsburg, Key West, Florida, moored to the pier at the U. S. Naval Base near the Little White House occupied by the President and his staff. Originally color but now faded.

title: Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: The Little White House, Key West, Florida, showing a view of the Commandant's House at the Naval Base, occupied by the President and his staff, from the south side, showing lawn and main entrance.

title: Charles Ross at a Reception for President Quirino
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross is shown with an unidentified lady at a reception for President Quirino of the Philippines at the Statler Hotel.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: Charles Ross on the Presidential Train
Scopenote: Snapshot of Charles Ross seated aboard the Presidential train.

title: Burning money at the Treasury Department
Scopenote: A workman is shown burning money at the Treasury Department.

title: President Truman and his Cabinet
Scopenote: Studio portrait of President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet seated around a table. Left to right around table: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming, Assistant to the President John Steelman, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder and Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: President Truman and members of his cabinet at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with members of his cabinet in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Clockwise: Secretary of Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming, Assistant to the President John Steelman, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of Treasury John Snyder; Attorney General Tom Clark. Similar to 70-1113.

title: Official campaign photo for the 1948 campaign
Scopenote: Official campaign photo of Harry S. Truman for the 1948 campaign, which has been signed by Mr. Truman "To Sidney W. Souers with the best of good wishes from his good friend Harry S. Truman White House Jan. 23, 1948."  This is the same image as photograph as 58-486.  From:  Sidney W. Souers Papers.

title: The President, Mrs. Truman and Margaret at American Newspaper Association Reception
Scopenote: Left to right:  Margaret Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and First Lady Bess Truman attend the American Newspaper Association reception, Hotel Statler, Washington, D. C.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Portrait of 1949 Cabinet
Scopenote: Original is oversized 11 X 14 studio portrait of the 1949 Cabinet seated around the table.  l to r: Julius Krug, Charles Sawyer, Alben Barkley, Maurice Tobin, Charles Brannan, Jesse Donaldson, James Forrestal, Dean Acheson, President Harry S. Truman, John Snyder and Tom Clark.  Oversize photo is filed in oversize file.  This is same photo is 64-3-14 but it is autographed and a small photo is in the Ross Metal album 96-99.

title: Distance View of John W. Snyder at Dinner of Democratic State Committee, Newark
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder is shown in this oversized photo of the annual anniversary Jefferson-Jackson dinner, Democratic State Committee, Newark, New Jersey.  Mr. Snyder is seated at the head table, top row, sixth from the left.  Others in the crowd are unidentified. ORIGINAL PHOTO IS IN OVERSIZED FILE.

title: Dean Acheson speaking before Canadian-American Defense Group
Scopenote: Dean Acheson is shown speaking before the Canadian-American Defense Group in Patuxent River, Maryland.

title: President Truman Greets His Family at Washington Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets Margaret (on the left) and Mrs. Truman (to the right) on his arrival from a nine day vacation in Key West. The photo was taken in Washington National Airport. The nine day vacation was preceded by a five day tour of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands and Cuba.

title: President Truman vetoes the Tax Reduction Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman aboard the U.S.S. Williamsburg, vetoes the Tax Reduction Bill as Charles Ross and William J. Hopkins, Executive Clerk, watch.  Same as 64-298.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman Attending Speedboat Races in Annapolis
Scopenote: Left to right:  President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross and Secretary of the Navy John Sullivan watch speed races at Annapolis, Maryland, from the deck of the escort ship Lenore.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman Watching Speedboat Races in Annapolis
Scopenote: Left to right:  President Harry S. Truman, (unidentified Navy officer in background), Press Secretary Charles Ross, Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan and Stanley Woodward, Chief of Protocol, watching speedboat races at Annapolis, Maryland from the deck of the escort ship Lenore.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Color snapshot of Charles Ross at Sun Valley, Idaho
Scopenote: A color snapshot of Charles Ross at Sun Valley, Idaho during President Truman's western trip.  Others are unidentified.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Harry Vaughan, Wallace Graham, and Others at Dinner in Berkeley, California
Scopenote: A group at a dinner in Berkeley, California during President Truman's western trip to California.  President Truman is not in the photo.  Front row, left to right:  Albert Kam Chow (unofficial mayor of San Francisco's Chinatown), Harry Vaughan, Wallace Graham, two unidentified women.  Second row (across table):  Unidentified officer, possibly Rose Conway, unidentified man.  From:  12x18 metal album from the Charles Ross Papers

title: President Truman waves in parade in Los Angeles
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves from the rear of a car during a parade in Los Angeles, California.  Same as photo 66-2645.    From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Rose Conway and Members of the White House Secretarial Staff
Scopenote: Rose Conway, President Harry S. Truman's personal secretary, is seated on a sofa with three other members of the White House secretarial staff prior to accompanying President Truman on his Western trip.  The women in the photo are, left to right: Shirley Green, Myra Houck, Rose Conway, and Myrtle Bergheim. See also 59-382.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman Waving from a Ski Lift
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown waving from a ski lift during his Western trip to Sun Valley, Idaho.  Same as 66-677.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: The First Family at the Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: An informal picture of the First Family at the Grand Coulee Dam. Shown with them is Charles Ross, on the far left, talking to Margaret Truman, and Bess Truman in foreground. President Harry S. Truman is mostly obscured by Washington Governor Monrad Wallgren and Manager of the Columbia River District of the Bureau of Reclamation Frank A. Banks. All have their backs to the camera. From: Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album. (See also 2012-216)

title: President Truman in Parade in Los Angeles
Scopenote: President Truman waves from the rear seat as he rides in a parade in Los Angeles, California.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman at University of California, Berkeley
Scopenote: President Truman is shown in cap and gown at ceremonies at the University of California at Berkeley in San Francisco, California. From: Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Margaret Truman Aboard the Campaign Train
Scopenote: Margaret Truman holds a press conference aboard the train during President Harry S. Truman's western trip.  They are near Kansas City.  See also 66-765 for same photo.  See 77-3744 for similar photo.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman and Charles Ross Watching Democratic Convention from Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Press Secretary Charles Ross are shown as they watch the Democratic National Convention via television in the Oval Office.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

Scopenote: A view from the south entrance to the White House showing the Jefferson Memorial in the distance and the Washington Monument.

Scopenote: View from the south of the south lawn and south portico of the White House, showing the portico after completion of the second floor balcony.

title: President Truman and Charles Ross at U.S. Naval Academy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left) and Press Secretary Charles Ross (facing President Truman) with others at Phlox Landing, U.S. Naval Academy, Annapolis, Maryland.

title: President Truman at U.S. Naval Academy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown with unidentified Naval officers standing on the steps of the U.S. Naval Academy at Annapolis, Maryland.  Same as 67-7605.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: President Truman speaking in Fort Worth, Texas
Scopenote: Distant aerial photo of the rostrum showing President Truman speaking before a huge crowd in Fort Worth, Texas.

title: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan Aboard the Carrier Shangri-La
Scopenote: Navy Secretary John L. Sullivan shown aboard the aircraft carrier U.S.S. Shangri-La.

title: Distance view of John W. Snyder in Miami at American Legion Convention
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder is seen standing at a podium while he speaks to the annual convention of the American Legion in Miami, Florida.

title: President Truman, Matthew Connelly and Charles Ross
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Matthew Connelly and Charles Ross, in casual attire, discuss a serious thought at Key West.  Similar to 66-932.

title: President Truman, Matthew Connelly and Charles Ross
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Matthew Connelly and Charles Ross, in casual attire, discuss a serious thought at Key West, Florida.  Similar to 66-93

Scopenote: Excellent photo of, Left to right:  Matthew Connelly, President Harry S. Truman, and Charles Ross in casual attire at Key West as they talk together by a tree.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: First Family at Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Bess, Harry, and Margaret Truman on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  Same as photo 66-931.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Vice-President Alben Barkley Arrive in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (waving hat) and Vice-President Alben Barkley ride in the car during a motorcade during arrival in Washington, D. C. after winning the election. Seated between them is Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath. All others are unidentified.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Matthew Connelly and Charles Ross at Key West
Scopenote: Matthew Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross arrive at Key West. They are walking down the street, accompanied by a parade and band. They are joining President Truman on vacation at Key West, Florida.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.
Institutional Creator: U.S. Navy, Fleet Sonar School (Key West, Florida)

title: President Truman, Charles Ross and Matthew Connelly at Key West
Scopenote: All hands turn out to welcome President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross and Matthew Connelly to Key West.  Press Secretary Ross has back to camera at left, greeting friends.  Matthew Connelly has back to camera second from left.  President Truman is in foreground with extended arm.  Donald Dawson can be seen at far left of photo.  Same as 64-194-7.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.

title: Charles Ross and Matthew Connelly in Key West
Scopenote: Charles Ross and Matthew Connelly are escorted down the streets of Key West, Florida by a brass band. They are walking behind the big drum. They are vacationing with President Truman.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 Metal Album.
Institutional Creator: U.S. Navy, Fleet Sonar School (Key West, Florida)

title: President Truman holds a press conference
Scopenote: President Truman holds a press conference on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West.  Shown seated is Charles Ross.  In the background in naval attire is Admiral William Leahy, Gen. Harry Vaughan, Stuart Symington and Clark Clifford.

Scopenote: Photograph of a Presidential staff conference in the White House office of the President.  Left to right:  President Harry S. Scopenote: An oversized photo showing President Harry S. Truman, Bess and Margaret Truman at the head table with Vice President Alben Barkley just before beginning his talk at the Truman-Barkley Cub Dinner.  Other Democratic notables and friends are in the audience. ORIGINAL PHOTO IS IN OVERSIZED FILE.

Truman, Vice-President Alben Barkley, and other notable Democrats are shown in this oversized photo taken at the Democratic National Finance Committee at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington.  Other prominent Democrats in the photograph include Clark Clifford, General Harry Vaughan, John W. Snyder and Press Secretary Charles Ross.  ORIGINAL IS IN OVESIZED FILE

title: Mrs. Dean Acheson paints in the attic-studio
Scopenote: Mrs. Dean Acheson, wife of the newly appointed Secretary of State, paints in the attic-studio of her Georgetown home.   Mrs. Acheson is referred to as a "third generation painter" for her mother and father's father were both artists.

title: Dean Acheson shown with the Canadian-American Defense Group
Scopenote: Dean Acheson is shown with the Canadian-American Defense Group at Patuxent River, Maryland.

title: Aerial view of the Naval Station at Key West
Scopenote: Aerial view of the Naval Station, Key West, Florida, showing the Presidential yacht, the Williamsburg, anchored at the dock in front of the administration building.  The Presidential quarters, the Little White House, is the white building behind the administration building.  Similar to 77-921.

title: Exterior view of the Little White House in Key West
Scopenote: Exterior view of the Little White House, Key West, Florida.

title: Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson
Scopenote: Left to right:  Unidentified man, Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson, artist Greta Kempton, and Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder.  This event is an unveiling of the Greta Kempton portrait of Jesse Donaldson.  The painting was a gift to Donaldson from the National Association of Postmasters.

title: President Truman at Boca Chica with press
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) interviews the press on their arrival at Boca Chica in Florida.  Same as 77-913.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: Harry Truman and others on the "Big Wheel," Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman aboard the fishing boat "Big Wheel" in Key West, Florida.  Left to Right around Mr. Truman:  Stanley Woodward, General Robert Landry, President Harry S. Truman, William Bray, and Press Secretary Charles Ross.

title: Dean Acheson testifies at the Senate Foreign Relations Committee about NATO
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson testifies before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee as open hearings began on the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: Dean Acheson is speaking at the annual dinner of the Bureau of Advertising
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown speaking at the annual dinner of the Bureau of Advertising of the American Newspaper Publishers Association at the Waldorf Astoria hotel in New York City.  Mr. Acheson's topic was the United States policy with respect to Germany.

title: Canada is the first country to commit to North Atlantic Treaty
Scopenote: Canada became the first country to commit itself to the North Atlantic Treaty, when Canadian Ambassador Hume Wrong, right, deposited with Secretary of State Acheson, left, Canada's "instrument of ratification" of the Treaty.  The brief ceremony took place at the State Department.

title: Arthur Godfrey and Dean Acheson at American Newspaper Publishers Association banquet
Scopenote: CBS radio and television star Arthur Godfrey (right) accommodates Secretary of State Dean Acheson with a light during a behind the scenes chat at the 27th Annual Dinner of the Bureau of Advertising of the American Newspaper Publishers Association in New York.  Both were guest speakers at the banquet.

title: Informal Portrait of John W. Snyder
Scopenote: Portrait of John W. Snyder taken at a Savings Bond Dinner held in Kansas City.  Original in oversized file.

title: The American Cathedral Church of the Holy Trinity in Paris, France
Scopenote: Shown is the American Cathedral Church of the Holy Trinity, Paris, France during the 32nd Annual Memorial Day Service.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Eben Ayers on the Patio of Shangri-La
Scopenote: Eben Ayers, scratching his head, is seated on the patio of Shangri-La, Franklin D. Roosevelt's retreat, with other unidentified people.

title: President Truman greets Gov. Sidney McMath at 35th Division Reunion in Arkansas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in hat) smiles and greets Arkansas Governor Sidney McMath (second from left), while Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder and Mary Jane Truman stand next to them during the 35th Division Reunion at Little Rock, Arkansas. Arkansas Lieutenant Governor Nathan G. Gordon is at far left. This photo is similar to 67-343.

title: Snyder on back of camel
Scopenote: Photograph showing Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder on back of a camel, probably in Cairo, Egypt during one of his trips abroad.

title: Norwegian Ambassador Wilhelm Munthe De Morgenstierne and Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) and Norwegian Ambassador Wilhelm Munthe De Morgenstierne look over a copy of the Atlantic Pact.  Norway became the fifth signatory of the 12-nation pact to deposit its instrument of ratification with the State Department.

title: Mrs. Perle Mesta Receives Official Commission of Office from Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Mrs. Perle Mesta receives her official commission of office from Secretary of State Dean Acheson after she was sworn in as U.S. Minister to Luxembourg. The ceremony took place at the State Department.

title: Dean Acheson, left, and Louis Johnson
Scopenote: Sec. of State Dean Acheson, left, and Defense Secretary Louis Johnson hold confidential conversation at the Start of the third secret Atomic meeting at the Capitol.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers

title: Secretary of State Dean Acheson before the House Foreign Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson shown as he appeared before the House Affairs Committee urging full approval of President Truman's $1,450,000,000 arms program.

title: Mrs. Georgia Neese Clark and Charles Ross
Scopenote: Mrs. Georgia Neese Clark, first woman to become treasurer of the United States, at the White House offices, gives Press Secretary Charles Ross one of the first one dollar bills to bear her name.  She signed it for him, with twelve others for President Truman.  A picture of the President at his desk is at the center.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: Dean Acheson holds a Copy of the China White Paper
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson holds a copy of the administration's long-awaited White Paper, which reviewed policy toward China since 1884.  It was released by the State Department today.

Scopenote: Photograph of Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder during a visit by he and President Truman to Des Moines, Iowa to address the National Amvets Convention.  This photo shows John Snyder (center) with unidentified group of men.

title: Dean Acheson, Senator Scott Lucas, and Others Attending a Luncheon
Scopenote: Attending a luncheon are left to right:  unidentified, Dean Acheson, Sen. Scott Lucas, Senator Thomas and unidentified.

title: Dean Acheson addressing United Nations
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is the second speaker to address the morning session of the United Nations General Assembly at Flushing, New York.

title: President Truman Visiting Naval Gun Factory
Scopenote: Snapshot of President Harry S. Truman visiting the Naval Gun Factory on the celebration of its 150 year anniversary.  President Truman is arriving in his automobile, being greeted by Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers (far left), unidentified military man, and General Harry Vaughan.  From:  Eben Ayers Papers.

title: President Truman Visiting Naval Gun Factory
Scopenote: Snapshot of President Harry S. Truman visiting the Naval Gun Factory on the celebration of its 150 year anniversary.  President Truman is climbing from limousine.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at right) touring the Naval gun factory on it's 150th Anniversary. Officers accompanying President Truman are unidentified.

title: President Truman Visiting Naval Gun Factory
Scopenote: Snapshot of President Harry S. Truman visiting Naval Gun Factory on the celebration of its 150 year anniversary.  General Harry Vaughan fifth from left; President Truman second from right.

Scopenote: Snapshot of President Harry S. Truman visiting Naval Gun Factory on the celebration of its 150 year anniversary.  General Harry Vaughan and President Truman together in center.

Scopenote: Snapshot of President Harry S. Truman visiting Naval Gun Factory on the celebration of its 150 year anniversary.  General Harry Vaughan and President Truman together in center.

Scopenote: Visit of President Harry S. Truman to the Naval Gun Factory on the 150th anniversary.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) visiting Naval Gun Factory on the celebration of its 150th year anniversary.  General Harry Vaughan is standing at left.

Scopenote: Snapshot of President Harry S. Truman (center) visiting Naval Gun Factory on the celebration of its 150 year anniversary.  General Harry Vaughan is second from left.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (looking at equipment in background) tours the Naval Gun Factory on it's 150th anniversary.  Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers is in background at right.  Other officers are unidentified.

title: President Truman Tours the Naval Gun Factory on it's 150th Anniversary
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tours the Naval Gun Factory on it's 150th anniversary.

title: Dean Acheson attending the funeral of Edward R. Stettinius
Scopenote: Among the many government officials attending the funeral service for former Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius at St. James Protestant Episcopal Church, was Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  Mr. Stettinius died October 28 at the age of 49.

title: President Truman and Dean Acheson at airport
Scopenote: President Truman is shown here bidding farewell to Secretary Dean Acheson (right) at the airport as the latter left for Paris and a Big Three meeting on Western European unity.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Dean Acheson in backseat of a car
Scopenote: Mr. and Mrs. Dean Acheson are shown riding in the backseat of a car.

title: President Truman and the Shah of Iran
Scopenote: Left to right:  two unidentified men, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, District Commissioner John Russell Young, President Harry S. Truman, the Shah of Iran, and unidentified man. They are at a welcoming ceremony in Washington, D. C.

title: Wide Eyed President Truman Enjoys the Army Navy Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is having a great time at the Army Navy Football game.   Donor: John E. Boos.

title: Dean Acheson bids farewell to President Truman, Mrs. Truman, and Margaret
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson bids farewell to President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman as the first family left Washington this morning for a vacation in Florida. Margaret, who completed her tour with a concert at Constitution Hall last night, carries a new camera for the vacation. They are at an airport.

title: Captain Cecil C. Adell welcomes the Trumans to Key West
Scopenote: Captain Cecil C. Adell (right) welcomes Bess, Margaret, and Harry S. Truman to Key West, Florida.  Same as photo 64-460.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: Mrs. Chiang Kai-Shek and Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt
Scopenote: Mrs. Chiang Kai-Shek (right) and Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt are seated together on the White House lawn while newsmen and photographers take pictures.

title: Vice President and Mrs. Alben W. Barkley, Dean Acheson, and Others at Reception
Scopenote: Vice President and Mrs. Alben W. Barkley enjoy a joke with their guests at a reception they gave in their Waldorf-Astoria Hotel suite just prior to the $100 a plate Democratic Party Dinner. Left to Right:  Mrs. Max Truitt, Mr. Barkley's daughter; Mrs. William M. Boyle, Jr., Mr. William M. Boyle, Jr., Mrs. Barkley, Vice President Alben Barkley, and Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  Mr. Boyle is chairman of the Democratic National Committee.

title: President Truman and Charles Ross in Convertible
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Press Secretary Charles Ross in convertible enroute to the beach in Key West Florida. This photo is similar to 64-427.

title: Charles Ross at Little White House in Key West
Scopenote: Charles Ross relaxes in a lawn chair on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

Scopenote: Photo of Eben A. Ayers, Assistant Press Secretary, at his desk.  Mr. Ayers seems to be deep in thought in this picture.
