Scopenote: Formal portrait of General Omar Bradley seated at his desk.  Original in a leather portfolio stored with albums.  Donor:  Thomas F. McDaniel.

title: Charles Ross at Press Conference
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross (right) at press conference, apparently in his office.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: Young lady in Evening Dress, Probably Relative of Charles Ross
Scopenote: Collection of snapshots of family of Charles Ross. Most are unidentified. 1950's full length photo of young lady, probably a relative of Charles Ross.

title: Formal portrait of Mr. Connie Mack
Scopenote: Formal portrait of Mr. Connie Mack, baseball manager.  Original in a leather portfolio stored with albums.  Donor:  Thomas F. McDaniel.

title: Ronald Reagan and John W. Snyder
Scopenote: Actor Ronald Reagan (right) and Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder together at an unknown banquet.

title: Eben A. Ayers at his Desk
Scopenote: Photo of Eben A. Ayers, Assistant Press Secretary, at his desk.  Mr. Ayers seems to be deep in thought in this picture.

title: Eben A. Ayers at his Desk
Scopenote: Photo of Eben A. Ayers, Assistant Press Secretary, at his desk. Mr. Ayers seems to be deep in thought in this picture.

title: John W. Snyder and General Douglas MacArthur
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (right) is shown with General Douglas MacArthur.

title: Portrait of Alben Barkley
Scopenote: Formal portrait of Vice President Alben W. Barkley.  Original is in a leather portfolio.  Donor: Thomas F. McDaniel.

title: John W. Snyder and Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder and Secretary of State Dean Acheson confer at a table during a conference.

title: John W. Snyder, Jesse Donaldson, and Carl R. Gray, Jr., Ship Out the First Batch of the G.I. Bill Insurance Checks
Scopenote: The first batch of the G.I. Bill Insurance Checks leaves the Treasury Department for local post offices where they will be held until January 16. Helping load the truck is Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; and Veterans Administration Carl R. Gray, Jr.

title: The U. S. and eight Atlantic Pact allies signed formal aid agreements
Scopenote: The U. S. and eight Atlantic Pact allies signed formal mutual aid agreements providing for rush delivery of $1,000,000,000 of American arms to free Western Europe with the next five months. Here, Norwegian Ambassador Wilhelm Munthe De Morgenstierne, Dean of the Diplomatic Corps (left), and Secretary of State Dean Acheson sign the pact.

title: Press Secretary Charles G. Ross with Reporters
Scopenote: Presidential Press Secretary Charles G. Ross(right), tells reporters at the White House February 6, 1950, that President Truman has invoked the Taft-Hartley law in an effort to restore coal production.  The President appointed a board of inquiry to look into issues; at dispute the order covering only the soft coal industry.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: Margaret Truman shown with her 26th birthday cake in Coral Gables, Florida
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (in hat and corsage) shown with her 26th birthday cake at the home of Marie Volpe in Coral Gables, Florida.

title: Secretary of State Dean Acheson with Senator Tom Connally
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson, left, holds whispered conversation with Chairman Tom Connally of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee as Mr. Acheson and ECA Administrator Paul Hoffman appeared before the House Foreign Affairs Committee.

title: Dean Acheson before Senate Foreign Relations Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson appears before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee to answer questions on how far the administration will go to stop Communism in Southeast Asia.

title: Charles Ross and an unidentified man
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross (at right) shakes hands with unidentified man during a receiving line at an unknown function.

title: Canadian Ambassador Hume Wrong signs the Canadian Water Diversion Treaty at Washington
Scopenote: Canadian Ambassador Hume Wrong signs the Canadian Water Diversion Treaty at Washington. Looking on are Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) and Senator Herbert Lehman (D-NY). The Treaty is designed to encourage greater power development from the Niagara River and increase the scenic beauties of Niagara Falls.

title: Dean Acheson testifying before the Senate Relations Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left), testifying before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, said that this country may give new economic aid to Chinese Formosa. Mr. Acheson and ECA Administrator Paul Hoffman (right), urged approval of a request for a $100,000,000 for the American sponsored Republic of South Korea.

title: Overview of diners at a dinner in honor of V. Adm. Merlin O'Neill
Scopenote: Former Secretary of the Treasurer and banker, John W. Snyder, Vice Admiral Merlin O'Neill and others are shown in the oversized photo of a dinner in honor of Vice Admiral O'Neill held at the Shoreham Hotel in Washington, D. C. ORIGINAL IS IN OVERSIZED FILE From: John W. Snyder Papers.

title: Three views of Dean Acheson speaking at the Commonwealth Club
Scopenote: Three studies of Secretary of State Dean Acheson as he addressed the largest gathering of the Commonwealth Club since the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt addressed them in 1932. Speaking on the Far East, he warned the Chinese people that they would bring "grave trouble" on to "aggressive or subversive adventures" beyond China's borders.

title: Distance view of Dean Acheson waving goodbye by a car as he leaves the University of California at Berkeley
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson hoists his hat and waves goodbye as he leaves the University of California at Berkeley, where he outlined his proposals for peace before a standing-room-only audience of 8,000 persons.

title: Dean Acheson delivers his foreign policy speech at the University of California at Berkeley
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson delivers his second foreign policy speech in two days before 8,000 students and faculty members of the University of California at Berkeley.  Mr. Acheson asked Russia to help put an end to the current Cold War.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Vice President Alben Barkley (left) and Secretary of State Acheson Exchange Greetings
Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley (left) and Secretary of State Dean Acheson exchange greetings--and smiles--at National Airport in Washington.  Barkley went to the airport to welcome Acheson back to the Capitol from California, where he made a major speech at the University of California at Berkeley.

title: Dean Acheson adjusts his glasses during a press conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson adjusts his glasses during a press conference, as he tells newsmen that if the "top Russian espionage agent" in the U. S. is connected with the State Department--as charged by Senator Joseph McCarthy--Acheson does not know about it.

title: Margaret Truman Taking Picture at a Key West Picnic
Scopenote: Margaret Truman is seen taking a picture during a picnic lunch in garden at Little White House, Key West, Florida.  Left to right: Donald Dawson, Stephen Spingarn, Charles Ross, William Hassett, Margaret Truman.

title: Margaret Truman Models Her Easter Bonnet
Scopenote: Margaret Truman models her Easter bonnet during visit to Key West, Florida, with her father on vacation.  Press Secretary Charles Ross is at right in background.  Same as 66-888 and 98-1732.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: Charles Ross at Eglin Field, Florida
Scopenote: A snapshot of Press Secretary Charles Ross (second from right) with unidentified others at Eglin Field, Florida.

title: A full length photo of a dapper Dean Acheson
Scopenote: A full length photo of a dapper Dean Acheson standing by a car.

title: Dean Acheson is interviewed at the Paris, France airport
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is interviewed at the Paris, France airport upon arrival for a diplomatic mission for the President. He arrived on the "Independence."

title: Dean Acheson being presented a portfolio at Paris, France
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown being presented a portfolio during the Paris, France diplomatic conference.  The other man is unidentified.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Arriving at the Paris, France airport are Averell Harriman, Dean Acheson and John Snyder
Scopenote: Shown upon arrival at the Paris, France airport during a diplomatic mission are left to right:  Averell Harriman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder.  Others are unidentified. The "Independence" is seen in the background.

title: Averell Harriman and John Snyder at the Paris, France airport
Scopenote: Averell Harriman (center) is shown with Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder beside him at the Paris, France airport.  They are here for a diplomatic conference for the President.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Dean Acheson in dapper dress with other unidentified persons
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown in dapper dress with other unidentified persons at an unknown location. Gentleman with him is the same as in 96-1180.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Dean Acheson with other men at the Paris, France Conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (third from left) is shown with unidentified men at the Paris, France conference.

title: Dean Acheson at the top of the stairs of the "Independence."
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown at the top of the top of the stairs of the Independence during a stop in Dakar, North Africa.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: A dapper Dean Acheson with unidentified man
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown in dapper dress with another unidentified gentleman.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Dean Acheson at the Paris, France airport being interviewed by reporters
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown at the Paris, France airport being interviewed by reporters upon his arrival for a diplomatic mission for the President.  The "Independence" is shown in the background.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Acheson and another gentleman at the Paris, France airport
Scopenote: Secretary of State and Mrs. Dean Acheson are seen riding in a car with another gentleman after arriving at the Paris, France airport.  Mr. Acheson is on a diplomatic mission for President Truman.

title: Cabinet members Dean Acheson and John Snyder at the Paris, France airport
Scopenote: Cabinet members Secretary of State Dean Acheson and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (center) are shown at the Paris, France airport during a diplomatic mission for President Truman.

title: Dean Acheson is greeted by an unidentified gentleman in Paris
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown at the Paris, France Conference being greeted by an unidentified gentleman.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Dean Acheson in Paris, France
Scopenote: Secretary of State and Mrs. Dean Acheson are shown at the Paris, France airport greeting well wishers. The Achesons are on a diplomatic mission to Paris and London. From: Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Averell Harriman, Dean Acheson, and John Snyder at Paris airport
Scopenote: Shown upon arrival at the Paris, France, airport during a diplomatic mission are, left to right: Averell Harriman, Dean Acheson, and John Snyder. The others are unidentified. The "Independence" is in the background. This is similar to 96-1164.

title: Dean Acheson arrives at the Paris, France airport
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson arrives at the Paris, France airport on the first leg of a diplomatic mission for the President.  He is shown descending the steps of the "Independence" being greeted by well wishers.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Dean Acheson is greeted by a gentleman at the Paris, France Conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is greeted by an unidentified gentleman during the Paris, France Conference.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Dean Acheson arriving in New York from Paris and London
Scopenote: Mr. and Mrs. Dean Acheson are show upon arrival in New York from their diplomatic mission to Paris and London.  The lady in the center is unidentified.  The "Independence" is shown in the background.  From:  Dean Acheson Papers.

title: President Harry S. Truman Blows out the Candles on Birthday Cake
Scopenote: Taking time out from a whirlwind speaking tour, President Harry S. Truman blows out the candles on one of the many cakes presented to him on his 66th birthday. The President addressed 5,000 rain-soaked persons in Lincoln, Nebraska. The President spoke about his administration's farm program.  Donor: John E. Boos.

title: President Truman in Spokane, Washington at Stockyards
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks at the Old President Harry S. Truman at the Stockyards in Spokane, Washington. He has received a Blue Ribbon naming him "Champion of Everything." The President called for a fight for the "Power Lobby" and to demand passage of his civil rights program.    Donor: John E. Boos.

title: A woman Demonstrator Pickets Dean Acheson Before the Savoy Hotel in London
Scopenote: A woman demonstrator, carrying a sign bidding Secretary of State Dean Acheson to "clear out", pickets before the Savoy Hotel in London, where the Pilgrims Society, for aiding Anglo-American friendship, was giving a dinner in honor of Acheson.

title: John W. Snyder at the Liberty Bell In Philadelphia
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder with a young lady dressed as the Statue of Liberty at the Liberty Bell in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The photo appears to be of a presentation ceremony.

title: President Truman at a weekly press conference
Scopenote: Elevated view of President Truman addressing a weekly press Conference.  Reporters must stand identify themselves before asking a question.  This is the first picture made of a Presidential press conference since they were moved from the White House to the Old State Department Building across the street.  Same as 66-2253.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: John Wesley Hyatt Award Dinner
Scopenote: John W. Snyder, in white jacket on the left, is shown with unidentified others at the John Wesley Hyatt Award Dinner at Hotel Pierre, New York City.  ORIGINAL IS IN OVERSIZED FILE  From:  John W. Snyder Papers.
Institutional Creator: Standard Flashlight Co., Inc., New York

title: Stanley Woodward is congratulated by Secretary of State Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Stanley Woodward, (1eft) former State Department Protocol Chief is congratulated by Secretary of State Dean Acheson after he was sworn in as U. S.  Ambassador to Canada.  Mrs. Woodward (center) will accompany her husband when he leaves for his new post to succeed the late Laurence A. Steinhardt, who was killed in a plane crash in March.

title: President Truman, Charles Ross on the Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Press Secretary Charles Ross, and others cruise on the Williamsburg.  From:  Charles Ross Papers, 12x18 metal album.

title: Members of the Massachusetts Action Committee For Peace picket a Dean Acheson speech at Harvard University
Scopenote: With their children at hand, a group of members of the Massachusetts Action Committee For Peace, pickets outside Harvard University, in a demonstration against Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  Mr. Acheson delivered an address to the Harvard graduating class and received an honorary degree.

title: Dean Acheson and Louis Johnson with Senators
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson and Defense Secretary Louis Johnson went before the Senate Appropriations Committee today to discuss funds for the foreign military aid program. Left to Right: Secretary Johnson; Senator Kenneth McKellar (D-Tenn.); Secretary Acheson; and Senator Styles Bridges (R-N.H.). Senator McKellar is the Committee Chairman.

title: Dean Acheson is shown following his press conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown following his press conference today at which he branded the North Korean attacks the most cynical, brutal, naked, and unprovoked aggression that could ever occur.  He warned that this was the time for very steady nerves and sober actions.

title: Dean Acheson and top military advisors leaving the White House following a meeting with President Truman
Scopenote: Left to Right, leaving the White House following a meeting with President Truman are his top military and Defense Chiefs:  General J. Lawton Collins, Army Chief of Staff; John Foster Dulles, Foreign Policy Adviser; Secretary of State Dean Acheson, and General Omar Bradley, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

title: Greta Kempton portrait of John Snyder
Scopenote: Greta Kempton portrait of John W. Snyder, which was presented and hung in the State Capitol Reception Room, Little Rock, Arkansas on April 27, 1947.

title: Secretary of Treasury John W. Snyder Testifies Before Senate Finance Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder shown as he tells the Senate Finance Committee that "increased disturbances to world peace" presumably spread of the Korean War, would make it necessary to boost instead of reduce taxes.

title: Presentation of Sesquicentennial Stamp to Chief Justice Fred Vinson
Scopenote: Presentation of the National Capital Sesquicentennial stamp takes place in Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson's office. Chief Justice Fred Vinson represented the Federal Government Judicial Branch. Carter Barron represented the Sesquicentennial Commission as Vice President of that Committee. The stamp went on sale to the general public on August 2 , 1950.

title: John Snyder and Carter T. Barron Present Scroll
Scopenote: Carter T. Barron, right, Executive Vice Chairman of the National Capital Sesquicentennial Commission, at a ceremony in Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder's (left) office, presents the Missouri Scroll to an unidentified man (center).  From:  John W. Snyder Papers.

title: Dean Acheson is followed by reporters
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (right)is followed by reporters as he leaves after a news conference.  Mr. Acheson, clearly anxious over reports that Chinese Communist troops are moving toward North Korea, said the U. S. is doing everything possible to convince the Chinese Reds that America has no aggressive intentions toward China.

title: Dean Acheson leaves the White House after a conference with President Truman
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson leaves the White House after a conference with President Truman.  Although Acheson refused to comment, it is presumed they discussed the shooting down of a Soviet-marked bomber by a U. N. fighter plane off the West Cost of Korea.

title: Secretary of State Dean Acheson Meets with Senator Tom Connally
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) meets in secret session with the combined Senate-House Foreign Relations Committees.  He discussed proposals which he planned to bring before the "Big Three" Foreign Ministers' meeting in New York.  At right is Senator Tom Connally (D. Tex.), Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.

title: Secretary of State Dean Acheson at North Atlantic Council Meeting
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) attends the meeting of the North Atlantic Council at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York. Several representatives of foreign countries met for this meeting. Also present is Charles M. Spofford (right).

title: Dean Acheson at the United Nations General Assembly
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson takes the floor of the United Nations General Assembly at its first session.  After a blistering attack had been launched on him by Soviet Foreign Minister Andrei Vishinsky, on China policy, Mr. Acheson suggested proposals to seat a representative of the Communist Chinese regime be considered later in the session.

title: Dean Acheson Confers with Edith Sampson and Warren Austin
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) confers with Mrs. Edith Sampson and American United Nations' delegate Warren Austin, at the first meeting of the United Nations' General Assembly. Mrs. Sampson is the first Black American woman given a high U.N. post. She is an alternate delegate for the United States. From: Dean Acheson Papers.

title: Dean Acheson addresses the United Nations General Assembly
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson addresses the United Nations General Assembly.  Mr. Acheson proposed a U. N. program to be backed by military force to oppose aggression anywhere world over, and marked a mile-stone in American policy by advocating land-reform in backward areas.

title: The USS Missouri at Chong Jin, Korea Firing a 16' Salvo
Scopenote: The USS Missouri at Chong Jin, Korea, firing a 16' salvo in an effort to cut northern Korean communications. Chong Jin is only 39 miles from Soviet border.

title: Dean Acheson, Nasrollah Entezam, and Vincent Impellitteri at United Nations Dinner
Scopenote: At a dinner given in honor of retiring United Nations General Assembly President Carlos P. Romulo, left to right:  Secretary of State Dean Acheson, New United Nations Assembly President Nasrollah Entezam, of Iran (center), and acting Mayor of New York Vincent Impellitteri.  The function took place at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.

title: Dean Acheson signs autographs at the Metropolitan Opera House
Scopenote: At the Saddler's Wells Ballet in the Metropolitan Opera House in New York City, Secretary of State Dean Acheson signs autographs for guests.

title: Rear Admiral Sidney W. Souers, Special Consultant to President Truman
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Sidney W. Souers, Special Consultant to President Truman, addresses the graduation exercises of the FBI National Academy conducted in the Departmental Auditorium, Washington, D. C.

title: John W. Snyder receives a plaque in New York City
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (left) receives a plaque of "Outstanding Public Service for his unselfish devotion to duty" from Mr. Durning, Collector of the Customs, and from the New York City Postmaster, not identified, at a Federal Business Association Luncheon in New York.  From:  John W. Snyder Papers.

title: Dean Acheson at the 9th anniversary of Freedom House
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson speaks at the Hotel Commodore in New York City, during the 9th anniversary dinner of Freedom House. He received the 1950 Freedom Award.

title: John W. Snyder with Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (left) laughs with an unidentified man during a light moment.  From:  John W. Snyder Papers.

title: Dais of John Snyder and guests at Testimonial Dinner
Scopenote: Dais of guests at Testimonial Dinner for Attorney General James Howard McGrath at the Commodore Hotel in New York, New York.  Left to right: Federal Trade Commissioner James M. Mead, Hon. Generoso Pope, Jr., General of the Army Mark W. Clark, Secretary of Treasury John Snyder, Judge Paul Rao of the U.S. Customs Court, Mr. Irving Geist, boy unidentified, Attorney General James McGrath (partially obscured).  See also 61-160-01.

title: John Snyder and Others at Testimonial Dinner for Hon. J. Howard McGrath
Scopenote: Shown left to right at the Testimonial Dinner in honor of Hon. J. Howard McGrath, given by Col. Francis Vigo Post #1093 American Legion, at Hotel Commodore, New York City, are Gen. Mark W. Clark, John W. Snyder, and Judge Paul Rao.

title: Navy Under Secretary Francis P. Whitehair during the presentation of Naval Safety Awards at the U. S. Naval Academy
Scopenote: Navy Under Secretary Francis P. Whitehair (second from right), Naval officers, and unidentified women seated during the presentation of Naval Safety Awards at the U. S. Naval Academy at Annapolis, Maryland.

title: Navy Under Secretary Francis P. Whitehair with unidentified men at the Naval Air Station, Sanford, Florida
Scopenote: Navy Under Secretary Francis P. Whitehair (sunglasses) with unidentified men at the Naval Air Station, Sanford, Florida.

title: Dean Acheson talks to the nation
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson, in a speech to the nation, says that the United States desires peace and is seeking to negotiate peaceably (in the Korean War), but if the actions of Communist China and other nations shows this to be impossible, the United States will meet force with force.

title: Dean Acheson leaves the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson leaves the White House today after attending a conference between President Truman and Congressional leaders at which the President asked for a $18,200,000,000 program to expand the armed services and boost atomic weapons productions.

title: President and Mrs. Truman and guests at Army-Navy game
Scopenote: Close-up view of President and Mrs. Truman with other guests not identified, at the Army-Navy football game.  This is a close-up view of 77-1477.
Institutional Creator: The News, New York's Picture Newspaper

title: Harry Truman, Bess Truman, Charlie Ross, and others at Army-Navy Game in Philadelphia
Scopenote: (Front row, left to right, starting the third from the left) President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, Press Secretary Charles Ross, Tom Clark, and Treasury Secretary John Snyder attend the Army-Navy football game.  Navy beat Army 14-2.  The game was held in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: Close-up of Margaret Truman at a press conference at the White House
Scopenote: Close-up of Margaret Truman (in hat) at a press conference at the White House. Similar to 81-151. Donor: John E. Boos.

title: Navy Under Secretary Francis P. Whitehair in the barber shop at the U. S. Naval Training Center, Great Lakes, Illinois
Scopenote: Navy Under Secretary Francis P. Whitehair (left) in the barber shop at the U. S. Naval Training Center, Great Lakes, Illinois.  The barber is African-American.

title: Dean Acheson and Senator Brien McMahon
